column2: Position responsible for all the F&B operations, which includes all restaurant, beverage and room service & banquet operations. Develops and implements business plan for food & beverage.

Interested candidate can send their resume on  pranali.dhanawade@dmartindia.com  or contact on  9930463108. Only Male candidates preferred.  Experience  : 10 to 15 years of warehousing  (Manufacturing, QSR, Retail)  experience in heading and managing operations (Inbound/Outbound) and related network in an ecommerce or a large complex environment. Should have experience in licensing, compliance, external environment management. Experience in handling multiple location or network in customer facing environment will be added advantage. Able to manage the managers. Job Description: Responsible for smooth and uninterrupted operations between fulfillment center (FC) & related Pick up Points (PUP) network Should be able to meet end to end turnaround time as per the KPIs defined and work on enhancing network efficiency & productivity Follow Standard operating procedures and policies (SOP&P) for warehousing domain and related PUPs Meet the profitability goals and successfully lead the team to achieve the organizational goals Should be able to handle various product categories including Food & Grocery, General Merchandise etc. Responsible to manage the Inbound/Outbound warehousing operations at region. Support and be part of expansion and growth planned for the region, with effective use of technology in the entire operations Set the strategies and oversee execution to optimize Warehousing cost, efficiency & productivity by identifying continuous improvement and operational excellence projects Responsible for driving and achieving targets for key Inbound KPIs such as Receiving, Put away, Order processing, Last Mile Delivery, Inventory Accuracy Responsible for analyzing and presenting network Cost & Service performance trends Focuses on design and development of new outbound process to manage the growing volumes Continuously ensure usage of Material Handling Equipment's to enhance operations Ensure that all the requirement of regulatory licenses and labor law are followed Ensure safe working environment at the warehouse & related PUPs Able to select location for PUPs and negotiate price with the landlords. Should able to handle larger group of employee 300+. Manage external issues. Liasoning and compliances handling.
column11: QSR, handling multiple location, compliances, Good People management skills, iasoning

column2: Role & responsibilities   Develop and implement strategic plans for the Food and Beverage department in alignment with the overall resort objectives . Lead and inspire a high-performing team to achieve exceptional service standards.  Menu Development and Innovation:  Oversee the creation and implementation of innovative and high-quality menus, considering seasonal offerings and guest preferences. Ensure a diverse range of culinary options, including specialty dishes and unique dining experiences. ?? Guest Experience Enhancement: Continuously elevate the guest dining experience by implementing creative concepts, personalized service, and attention to detail. Implement guest feedback mechanisms to monitor and enhance satisfaction levels.  Financial Management: Develop and manage budgets, ensuring cost-effectiveness while maintaining high-quality standards. Implement strategies to maximize revenue, control expenses, and achieve profit targets.   Quality Control and Standards: Uphold and enforce the highest standards of food quality, presentation, and service. Implement and maintain stringent hygiene and safety protocols. ??Team Development: Recruit, train, and mentor a skilled and motivated team, fostering a culture of excellence. Provide ongoing training and professional development opportunities for staff.   Vendor Relationships: Establish and maintain strong relationships with suppliers and vendors to ensure the sourcing of high-quality and fresh ingredients. Negotiate favorable terms and agreements to optimize procurement . Event Management: Oversee the planning and execution of special events, ensuring seamless coordination and impeccable service.   Compliance and Regulation: Ensure compliance with all relevant health, safety, and licensing regulations. Stay updated on industry trends and regulations to proactively implement best practices.  Communication and Collaboration: Foster open communication and collaboration within the Food and Beverage team and across other resort departments. Liaise with the executive management team to align F&B strategies with the overall resort vision.  Preferred candidate profile   Bachelors in Hotel management / Masters in Hotel Management   Should have experience more than 12 yrs+ Must be from 5 Star Property  Stakeholder management  Perks and benefits   CTC will not be constraint for right candidate
column11: Cost Control, Beverage, Food, PoS, Liquor law compliance

column2: As a                         F&B Captain                 at          The Bombay Canteen & O Pedro         , you will be an ambassador for the exceptional service and cuisine that are the characteristics of our dining experience.                                                                                                                                                                                      Ensure your warm, personal attention and knowledge of our outstanding Food & Beverage offerings makes guests feel unique and valued.                                                                                                                                                                                                         We have two roles open, one at The Bombay Canteen and the other at O Pedro.                                                                                                                                                                                                                      This role will report to the Restaurant Manager of the respective location.                 Our flagship restaurant,                  The Bombay Canteen                 showcases the wealth of India s cuisine by recreating local, seasonal dishes and reinterpreting age old Indian culinary traditions in a frequently changing menu.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Our next venture,                  O Pedro                 , pays homage to the energy of Goa in a menu that brings back the fun of tropical living with simple, sophisticated food and drink, with influences from the state s Portuguese history.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Bombay Sweet Shop                 is a modern day mithai shop which brings back the magic of mithai in a never seen before avatar, in a fun and contemporary way, while staying deeply rooted in traditions and techniques.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Our online venture -                  enthucutlet                 is a bimonthly food mag that brings you unusual stories about food in India, and our all-day cafe                  Veronicas                 , holds a piece of Mumbais heart in the iconic Jude Bakery, and showcases the best sandwiches, coffee, bakes, and wine                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 Responsibilities                       Understand how all items are procured, prepared and served to consistently offer professional, friendly and engaging service in an informative, casual and helpful manner.                     Carry out opening and closing procedures as per Peakscale checklists.                     Follow all safety and sanitation policies when handling food and beverage.                      Assist in training of Stewards for restaurant duties.                      Adhere to Hunger Inc. policies, procedures and service standards.                                         Requirements                       Previous point of sale system experience an asset.                     Excellent communication and organizational skills.                     Ability to work well under pressure in a fast paced environment.                     Strong interpersonal and problem solving abilities.                     Ability to focus attention on guest needs, remaining calm and courteous at all times
column11: Hospitality, SAN, Head Business Development, SOC, F&B Captain, CRM, I18n

column2: Role & responsibilities: 1.  Overall Operations of Imperia Club:  Lead and supervise all aspects of Imperia Club operations, including member services, facility maintenance, and event management. 2.  Management of F&B Outlets:  Oversee and manage all food and beverage outlets within Imperia, ensuring exceptional service quality and guest satisfaction. 3.  Club Operations:  Implement strategies to enhance the overall experience and membership engagement at Imperia Club, including programming, events, and member communications. 4.  Facility Management:  Ensure the effective operation and maintenance of club facilities, amenities, and common areas, adhering to industry best practices and safety standards. 5.  Amenity Management:  Oversee the management of all amenities provided by RUPL within the society, ensuring cleanliness, functionality, and optimal usage for residents. 6.  Vista Restaurant Operations:  Direct the operations of Vista Restaurant, including menu planning, staffing, and customer service, to deliver an exceptional dining experience. 7.  Lobby Cafes Management:  Supervise the two lobby cafes, managing operations and ensuring quality service delivery to residents and visitors. 8.  Caf Laguna & Banquet Hall Management:  Lead the overall operations of Caf Laguna and the Banquet Hall, including indoor and outdoor venues, to meet the diverse needs of residents and event organizers. 9.  Vendor Management:  Establish and maintain vendor relationships, negotiate contracts, and oversee vendor performance to ensure the highest standards of service and value. 10.  Technical and Operational Knowledge:  Utilize technical expertise to address operational challenges and optimize facility management processes for efficiency and effectiveness. 11.  Housekeeping Management:  Implement housekeeping standards and protocols to maintain cleanliness and hygiene across all facilities and common areas. Preferred candidate profile:   Bachelor's degree in Hospitality Management preferred. 18+ years of progressive experience in hospitality and facility management, with a proven track record of success in leadership roles within the real estate industry. Extensive experience working with top-tier developers and managing hospitality operations in      luxury residential communities or five-star hotels. Strong understanding of facility management principles, including maintenance, budgeting, and compliance. Exceptional leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to inspire and      motivate teams to deliver excellence. Strategic thinker with a customer-centric approach and a passion for creating exceptional living experiences.
column11: Hospitality Management, Property Management, Facility Management, facil, Facility Operations, Hospitality, Facility Administration, Guest Handling, food, Facilities, Cafeteria Management, Soft Services, Restaurant, Food And Beverage, Facility Services

column2: The exact job description can vary widely based on the nature of the organization and its objectives      General Secretary roles often involve tasks such as:Leadership and Management: Overseeing the day-to-day operations of the organization, implementing strategies, and working with other leaders to achieve the organization's goals      Communication: Representing the organization in public and official functions, maintaining communication with members, stakeholders, and the public, and responding to inquiries      Administration: Handling administrative tasks such as record-keeping, managing budgets, and coordinating events and meetings      Policy and Governance: Participating in the development of organizational policies and ensuring compliance with regulations and guidelines      Membership Management: Managing membership applications, renewals, and communication with members      Collaboration: Collaborating with other team members, departments, and external partners to achieve organizational objectives      Strategic Planning: Contributing to the development and execution of the organization's long-term strategic plans      Advocacy and Outreach: Representing the organization's interests and promoting its mission and values to relevant stakeholders and the broader community

Main Duties Administration: Ensures that the Food and Beverage activities are aligned with the respective Corporate Strategy, and that the Hotel Actions have been implemented where appropriate.  Oversees the preparation and update of individual Departmental Operations Manuals.  Conducts regular divisional communications meetings and ensures that departmental briefings and meetings are effective and conducted as necessary.  Customer Service: Ensures that all employees deliver the brand promise and provide exceptional guest service at all times.  Ensures that employees also provide excellent service to internal customers in other departments as appropriate.  Spends time in public areas observing employee-guest interaction and talking with guests, working through Heads of Department to coach employees in guest service skills as necessary.  Handles all guest and internal customer complaints and inquiries in a courteous and efficient manner, following through to make sure problems are resolved satisfactorily.  Maintains positive guest and colleague interactions with good working relationships.  Financial : Maximises employee productivity through the use of multi-skilling, multi-tasking and flexible scheduling to meet the financial goals of the business as well as the expectations of the guests.  Ensures that each profit centre (e.g. Outlet, Bar, Banquets) is operated in line with maximising profit while delivering on the brand promise.  Ensures that each cost centre (e.g. Stewarding) operates with the lowest possible cost structure while also delivering on the brand promise to the guest.  Coordinates the preparation of the Annual Business Plan for Food and Beverage.  Analyses business performance strategically to facilitate accurate and meaningful forecasting, involving the respective Heads of Department as appropriate.  Manages costs proactively based on key performance indicators, working through the respective Heads of Department as appropriate.  Ensures that all hotel, company and local rules, policies and regulations relating to financial record keeping, money handling and licensing are adhered to, including the timely and accurate reporting of financial information  Assists in the inventory management and ongoing maintenance of hotel operating equipment and other assets.  Participates in weekly yield and revenue management meetings actively, overseeing the appropriate pricing structures to maximise yield and overall profits in Outlets and Banquets.  Marketing: Prepares, utilises and updates an Annual Marketing Plan, broken down as necessary by department.  Evaluates local, national and international market trends, vendors and other hotel/restaurant operations constantly to make sure that the hotels own operations remain competitive and cutting edge.  Encourages Heads of Department to look for Marketing and Public Relations opportunities to increase awareness and ultimately business.  Operational: Ensures that all company minimum brand standards have been implemented, and that optional brand standards have been implemented where appropriate.  Monitors all operations, especially during peak business periods, working through the respective Head of Department to make adjustments where necessary.  Ensures that all Food and Beverage Top 20 are implemented.  Provides feedback on the results of the Consumer Audit and ensures that the relevant changes are implemented.  Works closely with other Leadership Team in a supportive and flexible manner, focusing on the overall success of the hotel and the satisfaction of hotel guests.  Ensures that Food and Beverage employees work in a supportive and flexible manner with other departments, in a spirit of We work through Teams.  Ensures that all employees are up to date with the availability of seasonal and new products on the market.  Tastes and monitors the food and beverage products served throughout the operation, providing feedback where appropriate. Personnel: Oversees and assists in the recruitment and selection of all Food and Beverage employees.?? Ensures that Heads of Department follow hotel guidelines when recruiting and use a competency-based approach to selecting their employees.  Oversees the punctuality and appearance of all Food and Beverage employees, making sure that they wear the correct uniform and maintain a high standard of personal appearance and hygiene, according to the hotel and departments grooming standards.  Maximises the effectiveness of Heads of Department by developing each of their skills and abilities through the appropriate training, coaching, and/or mentoring.  Conducts annual Performance Development Discussions with Heads of Department and supports them in their professional development goals.? Ensures that they in turn conduct annual Performance Development Discussions with their employees.  Ensures that each Head of Department plans and implements effective training programmes for their employees in coordination with the Training Manager and their Departmental Trainers.  Encourages employees to be creative and innovative, challenging and recognising them for their contribution to the success of the operation.  Supports the implementation of The People Brand, demonstrating and reinforcing .  Ensures that all employees have a complete understanding of and adhere to employee rules and regulations.  Ensures that employees follow all hotel, company and local rules, policies and regulations relating to fire and hazard safety, and security.  Feedback the results of the Employee Engagement Survey and ensures that the relevant changes are implemented.  Other Duties:   Is knowledgeable in statutory legislation in employee and industrial relations.  Understands and strictly adheres to Rules and Regulations established in the Employee Handbook and the Hotel?? policies concerning fire, hygiene and health and safety.  Ensures high standards of personal presentation and grooming.  Maintains strong, professional relationship with the relevant representatives from competitor hotels, business partners and other organisations.  Responds to changes in the Food and Beverage function as dictated by the industry, company and hotel.  Attends training sessions and meetings as and when required.  Carries out any other reasonable duties and responsibilities as assigned.
column11: Food And Beverage, Resort, food and beverage manager
